alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:14PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wayne, southwestern Pulaski and north central McCreary Counties through 1145 PM EDT... At 1113 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Parnell, or near Monticello, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Steubenville around 1120 PM EDT. Mill Springs, Betsey and Naomi around 1125 PM EDT. Frazer and Delta around 1130 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Quinton, Kidder, Pulaski County Park, Burnside, General Burnside S.P., Bronston, Tateville, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Somerset, Sloans Valley, Elihu, Alpine, Ruth and Grade. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
